## Emit() function

Emits a given vue event after execution with the return value being the event parameter.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
declare function Emit(event?: string): (target: any, key: string, desc: TypedPropertyDescriptor<TFunction<any, unknown[], Vue>>) => void;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  event | <code>string</code> | The name of the event to trigger, defaults to the method name |

<b>Returns:</b>

`(target: any, key: string, desc: TypedPropertyDescriptor<TFunction<any, unknown[], Vue>>) => void`

## Remarks

If a promise is returned, it will trigger the event after the promise has completed successfully. Will never emit on error, use [EmitError()](./vue-extra-decorators.emiterror.md) instead.

## Example


```typescript
@Component({})
export default class FooBar extends Vue {
  @Emit("save-success")
  private async saveFooBar() {
    // ... Implementation
    return { foobar: {} };
  }
}

```
